comments.body: While this isn't a bad idea, I'd say locator maps and enabling coordinates already do this.

Great idea. I went here exactly to ask for this.

I hate the need to press F3 and take note of coordinates in order to explore, its like cheating. The game should let you get these coordinates in an ingame way, or something similar. I think a GPS is a too "futuristic" item in minecraft world but a Sextant or an Astrolabe should be perfect.It could be only X and Z coordinates. The Y is not so dramatic, you can calculate it aprox from sea level (62) or bedrock (1 to 4).

In the nether it should work someway. If people uses normally F3 coordinates in nether to create shortcuts, there should be an ingame alternative. IE, you should create a nether compass, sextant, astrolabe with cuartz, soulsand or other nether ingredient.
A simple update to the Compass could just do the trick. It could either be a toggle in settings to show/hide coordinates when holding Compass, or an enchantment, called for example "Sextant".
it sounds cool.
Awesome!
i agree with this 100% because some enchantments from fishing go to waist because they go for so many different itms
I agree in a survival world I live right next to a village that is constantly being raided, and I get enchant books that have 100 different enchants on them, all for different things
Yes! This would be especially good for books that have lots of good enchantments for different tools or armor.
That would be great just like cobblestone, it has stairs

I like the idea of different path types, but i'm not enthusiastic about the application: Why not r-click with a spade on different "ground" blocks to have them form paths?

  • Grass - as now
  • Dirt - "muddy" trails
  • Course Dirt - almost gravel paths
  • Gravel - rocky (cobble bits in the gravel)
  • Cobble - uneven pathing
  • Stone bricks - worn flagstones (square rather than brick lain)
  • Polished andisite/diorite/granite - smooth (remove the 'edge' next to bordering path blocks)
  • Sand - does nothing 

All types of path would 'join' to each other, no matter the underlying block type.

thats an interesting idea, however if you did it this way what difference would it have to simply placing down a block by carving out the dirt and putting down cobblestone or brick, i'm thinking of a more connectable fence-type coding which can recognise and make guilded corners if you use better types or polished types of stone, similar to carpet.

Or two cobblestone/stone brick and dirt. And more variations of pathways. That would make four blocks. And maybe barren dirt. Take dirt place in oven and cook it. It would be a hard surface that nothing would grow on, but effected by water. And would become mud.
Eso es muy interesante Anthony.
How about it would do fire damage when eaten but has extremely high saturation
I think that is hardly possible, you need to waterlog a half block, but nice idea I vote for it
This would make building so much better; why don't we have this! :(
Not just one side: one corner in case of corner-panes, too!
Yes! This already sort of exists for stairs so why not glass panes and walls!
Spears go in a different post, fyi. :)
Got it, thanks! Maybe I should just do a different post about middle range weapons that has a further attack range than swords?
That's a bit of too much minerals but IM INTERESTED

Also, there could be a store in the village where you could buy things like Tools, Blocks, Weapons etc. And you could sell things to villagers, and they could give you gold coins instead of emeralds. Plus they would accept more things than the normal stuff. So this would be a lot more interesting for the game!!

I like the idea, but I would also like it if there were a better option for multiplayer currencies. It wouldn't do much in solo worlds but would do a lot on server survival worlds. Perhaps each coin press could have a unique fingerprint that it leaves on each coin marked in the name of the coin as well. This fingerprint could not be changes and coins could only be stacked with coins with the same fingerprint this way people couldn't create their own coin press and start counterfeiting money. Also it would be nice to have coins made from iron nuggets as well.

That's a very nice idea! I had an idea about what I could use for in-game currency, and this would simplify it much more. Also, fingerprinting would make it so my sister couldn't cheat like that by pressing money and buying all my good loot from fishing.
YES!!!!! THIS WOULD BE AMAZING! That could also be a rare job in the village to have a coin presser!!!

I love this idea, I ran out of wood and cobble, but had plenty of sand! I think it would make a lot of sense to have this be a less durable type of tool, but still functional when you just need that shovel!
I would think this should be in game but I would say it's too weak to be used as a mining tool. Same for a weapon.

Sticks are obtainable in Desert, so it makes sense you can craft tools out of sand since planks are pretty much unobtainable. (We shall ignore how you got that Crafting Table there)

This will help desert-only buffet survival as well.

Sandstone Weapons/Tools should be equal to Stone in mining speed/attack damage but have the same Durablity and Blocks Mineable (Stone/Coal Ore Only) as Wood.

I was actually thinking it would mine the same materials as stone and be faster than stone, but have much less durability. Also, attack speed for sandstone would be a little higher on all tools except the ax.
sandstone is very breakable, so sandstone should wear down a bit faster than normal stone.

Instead of a potion how about boots.  If you do the iron boots recipe but replace the ingots with iron blocks, you get weighted iron boots. They provide better defence than regular iron boots but you move slower and fall faster. When in the water, you could sink like an iron golem (this allows you the reach the sea floor faster)
No a potion would be better

this would be very funny to mess with friends

 

imagine shooting someone flying with an elytra and they just catapult into the ground
I have been trying to fall faster in Minecraft so that I can bounce higher off of slime blocks, it would be cool if there was this potion.

This would be great for use with cooking -- since potion-making is already a thing with the brew station/cleric job site, the smoker is already associated with meat/the butcher job site, and dyes are associated with the cauldron/leathermaker and with the loom/shepherd. Cooking over a camp fire is humankind's earliest food-cooking method but the world went crazy with the advent of the spice trade. This could be tied in with foraging as an update.
I was thinking the same thing. This will really help deal with the whole griefing menace on servers.
I would like something like this. There are other features that could be added - excluding the owner, anti-mob-spawning, etc.

I would suggest, to use splash potions. Maybe for each layer, you can put in one potion additionally. If you put in multiple potions, the effect could add up. It may make the beacon a bit over powered, but you could just make it cost more. Like 32 of what ever ore for example. It would just make PVP way better, especially, if you could go like crazy insane, put like 4 Splash potions in one beacon, each with level 3, you would already have mining fatigue 12. It would be impossible in that area to even mine a lever and make redstone safe on multiplayer servers. Especially if you would build with obsidian and Iron blocks. You of course would need to add the mining fatigue potion, but in total i think it isn't that much of a change, if the effect of beacons is selected by potions (splash potions for being more expensive than normal ones) as not many people use beacons currently, but it would just make there usecase bigger.

I like this. You'd want to have several options for who it effects to make it the most useful.  In team games the ability to have it effect other teams might be cool, have it effect hostile mobs...  any player other than the player who placed it...

The question is how to make a gui that makes sense and isn't too overwhelming.

it makes sense to add it to the beacon to provide incentive for other players to attack such bases
otherwise resources may be hidden and practically impossible to find

Beacons seriously need an overhaul with this and the ability to use tinted glass to make the beam invisible above it.  When the Trial Chambers were being worked on, I thought it'd be cool if there was a mining fatigue beacon in the heart of the chambers.  Many rooms with loot chests (now vaults) would be closed off with grate walls.  This way, they could only be broken through when the player reaches the heart of the chambers and disables it.
Pretty cool. I think it would also be fun if you could jump while on the ceiling, making you fall instantly and taking fall damage when you land, no matter what height.

Or maybe it had a limited time like 5s when you steady if you crouch in wall or ceiling it's infinite, but you cannot walk on certain blocks like sand,,soul sand,gravel etc. Enchanting stuff or something...
This is great for trolling my friends so Iâ€™m voting!
Maybe a different name, like the abyss block or the pitch-black block.

This should probably just be a reversed light block, that way it's not only not obtainable outside of creative but can also be used in adventure maps for lighting. Torches could be placed inside but their light level will decrease by the shadow level (or negative light level) of the block. It can be set to the max number to make torches ineffective. This would be great for fog, dark magic effects, ect.
It should be super rare like found only in almost bedrock level and like 100x more rare than diamond
what do carrots have to do with anything?
I was shore i put chariots?
Please also check my activity, thank you :)

1. I think that you are saying right.
  2. They should add a chariot.
  3. This is very good idea
I like the idea of an Oasis

Oasis convo can be found here (good news, it's "under review"): 

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360011248991-Oasis
I'm trying to build my version of the hanging gardens of Babylon in the desert, since that is where it was irl. But it just looks dead (as desert grass should), but it totally ruins the build.
Question: How can a Magnet destroy a mob/player/item?

I would like to see a tool that would help find buried ores that may be a few blocks away buried behind other blocks like diorite, granite or stone.  If you dig a path in a cave, the tool would let you know if there were any ores to mine in the direction you could be looking.  This could be a special helmet or a handheld tool.

 

This could also be useful for finding buried treasure chests hidden in sand forts.

Manufacturing maglev train with magnetic iron block.

XD

How about if a player is wearing iron armor then they will be pulled towards the magnet? 
Or if they're wearing Iron Boots they could walk up a line of magnet blocks like a ladder, or stick to a magnetic ceiling?

Currently this is too op of an item for it only costing a few iron and wool and it able to destroy mobs.

Let's simplify this. When Lightning Strikes a fully weathered copper block, or a lightning rod above the weathered block, then that block becomes magnetized. magnetism can spread to all fully weathered stairs, slabs, and blocks by a magnetized block touching a normal weathered one.

Magnetized Weathered Copper Blocks would attract all iron items to them. Mobs or Players walking on these cannot jump and they can only move very slowly, BUT, they can walk on the side and upsidedown of the block instead of falling. You can also levitate up to these blocks if you have an iron helmet and iron boots on.
Maybe Clustering, Grapeshot, or Shotgun?
I definitely like grapeshot and clustering, but i'm not sure about shotgun. I have a few suggestions: Splatter, Splash, Multi-Shot, Arrows of many. Hope you take some of these into consideration!
lol, it's kind of like the enchantment on the crossbow
i'll just use the crossbow for this one.
you mean multishot?
But there is an enchantment that called multishot that makes crossbows shoot three arrows, so this obviously wouldnt make a difference.

For me, it's six of one, half a dozen of the other.  It can also be really convenient to just be able to close the GUI and have the items automatically go back into my inventory.  I think I might even miss that feature more than I would appreciate the fact that they could hold their items.

I don't want to make another topic, so I'll write it here. It would be nice if enchanting table could store lapis just like brewing table can hold blaze powder. Only lapis, enchanted (or not) items should return to player inventory after enchanting.
I'd add this only for the lapis in the enchanting table though. Like how the brewing stand keeps the items. Crafting table and anvil doesn't really make sense...

I had a post about Chorus Flowers growing underneath the islands, but this is even better. However, the color of the roots should be a darkish purple since this is the end that we are talking about. This would be a sick color for the Aether though.
Interesting idea.  I do think this is a bit overpowered.  However, I do think this should happen if you die with a totem of undying.  Also, if you have an elytra, you can fly out.
Interesting idea.  I do think this is a bit overpowered.  However, I do think this should happen if you die with a totem of undying.  Also, if you have an elytra, you can fly out.
